items.q: Which of these countries was part of the Allied Powers in World War II?
items.explanation: Britain stood against the Axis Powers along with the US, USSR, and others.

items.q: Neil Armstrong was the first person to walk on the moon.
items.explanation: He stepped onto the lunar surface in 1969.

items.q: The American Civil War was fought between the United States and Great Britain.
items.explanation: It was fought between the Northern states (Union) and the Southern states (Confederacy).

items.q: Who was the 16th President of the US, known for leading the country during the Civil War?
items.explanation: He is also famous for issuing the Emancipation Proclamation.

items.q: What historical period in Europe was characterized by a surge of interest in classical learning and values, meaning 'rebirth'?
items.explanation: It started in Italy in the 14th century.

items.q: Who is considered the founder of the Mongol Empire?
items.explanation: He united the nomadic tribes of the Mongol steppe.

items.q: What ship carried the Pilgrims to America in 1620?
Which famous scientist developed the theory of relativity?
items.explanation: His work fundamentally changed physics in the 20th century.

items.q: What ancient empire was ruled from the city of Rome, Italy?
items.explanation: It dominated the Mediterranean for centuries.

items.q: Who refused to give up her seat on a bus in Montgomery, Alabama in 1955?
items.explanation: Her action sparked the Montgomery bus boycott.
